title: League of legends launcher won't open!
body: Whenever I attempt to open League of Legends, the logo would pop up, but then it will close itself out. Is there a fix to this?

replies.body: I had the exact same problem. What worked for me was that I went into Riot Games --> League of Legends --> RADS --> Projects and deleted all folders except for lol_air_client and lol_air_client_config_xxxx (depends on what server you are on). After I deleted them I started the game again and I saw the logo loading. I had to wait for like 20-30 sec until the game started up fully patched and I could log in. I hope this works for you too.
It seemed that for NA, only deleting _lol_launcher_ & _lol_patcher_ works fine, avoiding the time it takes to re-patch the client.
ok i found it and deleted it and repatchedd, still cnat open
Just go to the LoL icon on your desktop, then right click it and press open file location, opne the folder named RADS and delete the things inside it

If you have AVAST, then that might be your problem, it just added LOL to my list of programs to block, so i had to remove it from the list in order to run league again. My friend had the same problem and is the one who helped me with it.

I can confirm this and I'm glad you posted this! I uninstalled and reinstalled from a CLEAN state (revo uninstaller) and was still getting a short logo pop up. 

If you right-click the tray icon for AVAST, then click Virus Chest, there is more than likely some entries in there for the League launcher. Just right click the entry(ies) and choose to restore and add to exceptions.....I don't know what could've changed recently because AVAST has never done this before but I'm glad this dude suggested the fix!!!!!!
Omg life saver! Maybe avast had some new update to block league, but this is the firs time it happened today. TYTY{{champion:37}}

Aww. Thanks guys!! 
Y dafuq is avast doing this now? never been a problem before..
Thanks, this fixed my issue as well.

thank you ^_^
it works for me ;)

My avast also blocked it. I removed it from the chest, but didn't add it to the exceptions or anything. The game still wasn't working. So I uninstalled avast, and unfortunately, the game STILL won't load. 

I don't know what else to do :/

Hey did this work and how do I check if it blocked it. I downloaded avast 3 days ago and didn't have an issue. Yesterday it took awhile to get into a game. Today I deleted everything because I literally tried everything, I tried reinstalling and it will not open for the life of me.

I just started a quick scan and clicked on the left-most link at the bottom (quarantine), then i saw "LoLLauncher.exe" in the list, right clicked it and chose "restore and add to exclusions" and it worked for me.

Thank you. This post worked for me. I deleted everything that the most common suggestion told us to do. Still didn't launch and had the same issue with only seeing the logo for a second and nothing happening. I did the Avast restore and add to exclusions thing Frank Ze King suggested and I was able to log in after a short download from me deleting the files in RADS. 

I suggest if you use Avast to look into this first before deleting anything. Again thank you guys.

Right click the LoL icon on your desktop, choose open containing folder, Open the RADS folder, Open projects and delete all files except lol_air_client and lol_air_client_config_xxxx (depends on what server you are on).
Thanks for posting this
works
What works? repatching steps? they did nothing for me btw, thanks.

Hey everyone,

When you start League of Legends by launching the shortcut or the .exe, some quick steps happen immediately on the back-end.  When the League of Legends logo appears, the patcher itself needs to check if it is properly up to date by checking files found on your computer to make sure it can launch properly.  Once it checks this, it contacts our servers to see if there is any update that needs to be downloaded for the patcher itself.  

If the patcher allows the logo appears, but then goes away and ***nothing happens***, this does appear to be the patcher failing to patch itself.  The steps in this guide should help resolve this issue:

https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/28732434-Patching-Issues

If you are still unable to get the patcher to appear normally, regardless of the steps in this guide, then make sure to [submit a ticket](https://support.leagueoflegends.com/anonymous_requests/new) to us.  We can take a deep dive into your issue, analyze some logs and figure out just what the hell is going on.  If you do submit a ticket, include the following:

1) Network Analysis: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1

2) NetworkInfo Log: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4

3) Process List: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3
Not sure if this will get seen. However, I am having the problem that you describe, and the patching link that you sent is a dead link.

try this: 
1. find "c:\windows\system32\drivers\etc\" and rename the file "hosts" to anything else
2. run lol launcher
3. if start updating, that was the problem if dont work better rename again the file to "hosts"

ty guys i did what berzane said and it is working
Yo guys, run League as Admin. Can rightclick -> advanced -> check run as admin -> apply. That will work for most of you. I can't help further.
I've done that... most people here know to run as admin

Same problem.  I'm running Windows 8.1.  I've uninstalled LoL and reinstalled it in a separate location to makue sure no previous corrupt files exist.  I've run the installer as admin.  One bit of success I had was to change the permissions on the rads_user_kernal.exe to run as admin by default.  This allowed the installer to start once, but died at the login screen on a login attempt.  I am back to square one with the original bug.  This seems like it is either an issue with a LoL update or a Windows update. 

What the heck is going on???

Edit:  The last time it ran successfully was Sunday around 4:00 PM MST.  Something since then seems to have broken it.  I will attempt a system restore to before that point and report success or failure.
I have the same issue, it will try and open up and the logo will appear and then it closes and says that the progam has stoppped working, please help?

I also have this problem.

But now when I click on the league of legends shortcut, the logo pops up and automatically closes shortly after. I followed the steps from the linked website by dArtagnan but none of the provided solutions help. Moreover, I'm pretty sure this is not a isolated issue, so I don't really want to send a ticket and go through all that tedious work. I'm hoping Riot can do a hotfix sometime soon cause I think this is a widespread problem rather than just a selected few.
{{summoner:4}} FUCK THAT! I JUST GOT IT. IT WORKS FOR ME: CTRL+ESC, SEARCH SERVICES. FIND WINDOWS FIREWALL. THEN STOP IT!! THEN RUN LOL AS ADMIN!!
